## Introduction: Breast Cancer

Prevalence: 12% in women.

Mortality rate: 2,7%.

Symptoms: little to no before it is widespread

Tumor types: (Vary in location, size, shape and severity)

- Basal-like
- HER2-enriched
- Luminal A
- Luminal B


## Materials: Data

Data Origin

The raw datasets:

- 'patients': 105 cancer patients, 29 variables
- 'proteomes': protein expression of 12553 genes for 77 cancer patients, 3 duplicates and 3 healthy.
- 'PAM50': Describes each gene further

## Methods: Data Modifications

'proteomes'

- removed 8 columns (2 insignificant, 3 duplicates, 3 healthy)

'patients'

- merged with modified 'proteomes' to create 'BC_data'

'BC_data' 

- 77 cancer patients, 29+12553 variables
- Argumentation: changed some column elements from text to numeric


## Methods: Analysis

GLM on each Breast Cancer Type

Venn-diagram to observe common significant genes

Gene expression profiling of the common genes

common genes with PAM50 Dataset

PCA and clustering
